ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Great intro to basic physics.
I learned a lot about physics!
Physics
Optics, magnetic fields, electromagnetism, circuits, current, induction, electric fields, Gaussian surfaces, refraction, reflection.
E&M and optics.
EM physics and optics. More calculus based physics practice
Basic foundation in electricity and magnetism
Phys 181 is a lot more interesting than 180. I feel like I could conceptualize physics a lot better after this course than I could after 180.
This was an introductory course to Physics. We learned some concepts around electricity, magnets, optics, etc.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It goes very fast
The teaching staff of the course is amazingly helpful.

Strengths: absolutely the TFs
Weaknesses: sometimes the professor would be unclear, or would not communicate with the TFs so section and lecture were not completely aligned
Its fast-paced but the professor did a really great job going through a lot of practice problems to keep us engaged and on track.
Professor Ghiassi was the strength of this course. He's so nice and understanding of the crazy work schedules of premeds. Also the fact that it was in person made it so much better than 181.

I think a weakness of this course is how it's taught. I don't think that the quantity of material that this course seeks to cover can be properly taught in the time allocated. The material is also spread out too thinly in my opinion. I feel like I wanted more guidance on the example problems rather than just listing random problems and going through them. I felt that there was little to no overall direction.

I'm not sure how to improve it, but I really felt that the structure of the class was designed to "technically" touch on all topics and concepts but never really help anybody learn it from the ground up.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: It's intro physics. Take it if you need it, no reason to take it if you don't need it.
Yes, especially if it is taught by Mehdi.
Yes! The physics is really good
Pre -req
The material is interesting and the workload is not too bad if you are able to understand the lectures.
Yes, I actually have never heard anyone complain about the off-sequence and so much emotion about the regular sequence.
Very different from the on sequence physics class. A lot more chill; I recommend
Its not bad, would recommend taking 180/181 off sequence as compared to on-sequence.
If you need to take physics take it with Professor Ghiassi. His psets are so nice and his exams are fair. He's also really understanding of your schedule and cares about your well being.

I would recommend this material to another student because it's interesting stuff but the course itself no. I think the course structure has room to improve. Be ready to learn from the book and not from class.
